title: UCMDB CI components for DND
content:
The following illustration depicts the components hierarchy based on CI types.

CI Types

CI Types are Component Types specific for creating Service Designs that could be integrated with UCMDB Provider to be created and realized within UCMDB. The CI Types are available in the UD/UCMDB Palette (CI Types based). The available CI Types are listed in the below table:

Parent component CI Type Description
Configuration item CI Collection Generic logical collection of components that are of type - Infrastructure Element or Running Software.
Infrastructure Element Contains infrastructure service components such as, individual servers or server groups that are required in a service design.
Business Element Business Element is a basic class for all components that support a particular business function, produce a product or provide a service that's visible to customers.
Infrastructure Element Application Resource A base component type that's used to derive component types representing application resources.
Application System The super class of complex systems like ERP, CRM or a Call-Center.
Cloud Service A generic class to represent all kinds of services provided by public cloud.
Node Represents a general purpose machine and is a base component type from which other component types representing devices such as, Virtual Machines will be derived.
Node Element  Node element resource
Running Software Represents the runtime aspects of a software that's running or is intended to be running on a server and is a base component type from which other component types representing various software will be derived.
Node Net Device The Net Device class represents a specific purpose machines such as Routers, Switches, Printers.
Server A Server represents a general purpose machine which has an IP address, such as Windows or Unix servers.
Application Resource AWS Resource A base component type that's used to derive component types representing aws resources
Azure Resource A base component type that's used to derive component types representing azure resources
Database Resource A base component type that's used for database resources
Google Cloud Resource Google Cloud resources being used in Google Cloud Platform.
Kubernetes Resource Kubernetes Resource
WebService Resource A base component type used to derive component types that represent webservice resources
Application Server Docker Container This component type represents an instance of Docker Container.
J2EE Server This component type represents a J2EE application server.
Application System SAP HANA Database SAP HANA Database
SAP System A logical unit, grouping together SAP-related entities (and possibly other entities as well) into one homogenous SAP deployment.
AWS Resource Amazon EBS Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) provides persistent block storage volumes for use with Amazon EC2 instances in the AWS Cloud
Amazon S3 Bucket  A bucket is a container for objects stored in Amazon S3.
AWS Stack Amazon Cloud Formation Stack.
Azure Resource Azure Resource Group A container that holds related resources for an Azure solution. The resource group includes those resources that you want to manage as a group.
Azure Availability Set An Availability Set is a logical grouping capability for isolating VM resources from each other when they are deployed.
Azure Network Interface A network interface enables an Azure Virtual Machine to communicate with internet, Azure, and on-premises resources.
Azure Network Security Group A network security group contains security rules that allow or deny inbound network traffic to, or outbound network traffic from, several types of Azure resources.
Azure Resource Group A container that holds related resources for an Azure solution. The resource group includes those resources that you want to manage as a group.
Azure Storage Account An Azure storage account contains all of your Azure Storage data objects: blobs, files, queues, tables, and disks. The storage account provides a unique namespace for your Azure Storage data that's accessible from anywhere in the world over HTTP or HTTPS.
Azure Storage Container A container organizes a set of blobs, similar to a directory in a file system under the specified Storage account.
Azure Subnet Subnets enable you to segment the virtual network into one or more sub-networks and allocate a portion of the virtual network's address space to each subnet
Azure Subscription Configure your Subscription for Microsoft Azure.
Azure Virtual Network Azure Virtual Network (VNet) is the fundamental building block for your private network in Azure.
Business Element Service A Service is an abstract class which may represent an IT or Business Service, including Infrastructure Services which are delivered by IT in support of a Business Service.
CI Collection Infrastructure Service It contains a collection of infrastructure service components, such as Server Groups, that are needed in a service design.
Server Group Represents a server group which contains one or more servers.
Cloud Service Cloud Database Service A generic class to represent all kinds of services provided by public cloud.
Database Microsoft SQL Server Represents an MS SQL Server database server.
MySQL database Represents an MS SQL Server database.
Oracle Database A component type that represents an Oracle database server.
PostgreSQL database Represents a PostgreSQL database
Vertica Instance A component type that represents a Vertica instance.
Database Resource Oracle Pluggable Database A PDB (Pluggable Database) is an entity that contains the data and code required for a specific set of features
Google Cloud Resource Google Cloud SQL Google Cloud SQL is a fully-managed database service that makes it easy to set up, maintain, manage, and administer your relational databases on Google Cloud Platform. You can use Cloud SQL with MySQL, PostgreSQL, or SQL Server.
Infrastructure Element Application Resource A base component type that's used to derive component types representing application resources.
Application System The super class of complex systems like ERP, CRM or a Call-Center.
Cloud Service A generic class to represent all kinds of services provided by public cloud.
Node Represents a general purpose machine and is a base component type from which other component types representing devices such as, Virtual Machines will be derived.
Node Element  Node Element 
Running Software Represents the runtime aspects of a software that's running or is intended to be running on a server and is a base component type from which other component types representing various software will be derived.
J2EE Server JBoss Application Server This component type represents a JBoss application server.
Weblogic Application Server A component type that represents a Weblogic Application Server.
Kubernetes Resource Kubernetes Controller A component that represents Kubernetes Controller
Kubernetes Deployment Config A component that represents Kubernetes Deployment Config
Kubernetes Service A component that represents Kubernetes Service
Kubernetes Namespace A component that represents Kubernetes Namespace
Kubernetes Pod A component that represents Kubernetes Pod
Load balancer software F5 BIG-IP LTM Represents a F5 BIG-IP Local Traffic Manager software.
Net Device Load Balancer Load Balancer device.
Node Net Device The Net Device class represents a specific purpose machines such as Routers, Switches, Printers.
Server Represents a general purpose machine which has an IP Address such as, Windows or Unix Servers.
Node Element Installed Software A component type that represents a installed software on a node
Network Connection A Network Connection component type describes the relationship of an interface of a Server to a Virtual Network
Storage Volume A component type that represents a region of storage on which a file system can be created
Running Software Application Server Represents a server that hosts an API to expose business logic and business processes for use by third-party applications.
Database Represents a database management system.
Load balancer software A Load Balancer Software component that represents a component type for all Load Balancer software.
Web Server Represents a software that accepts http requests and delivers web pages as a response.
Web Server Apache Tomcat This component type represents an instance of Apache Tomcat web server.
IIS Web Server This component type represents an IIS web server.
Apache Web Server This component type represents an instance of Apache Web Server.
WebService Resource Web Service  A component type that represents a web service.

CI relationship created in UCMDB by DND

To view CI relations created in UCMDB by DND:

  1. Go to UCMDB Local Client.
  2. In IT Universe Manager, select a CI in the Topology map or the CI Selector and select the Related CIs tab.
  3. Click the Enable Related CIs Retrieval button.
  4. The selected CI is displayed with its related CIs.

The CI and CI relationships are not deleted when a service design is undeployed.
